info.author: Chris McDonough
classifiers: Topic :: Software Development :: Libraries :: Python Modules
info.description:
The Zope ClockServer product provides a mechanism for users to call Zope object
methods without the use of an external clock source (e.g. cron/wget). It
operates by acting as a medusa "server", essentially coopting Zope's asyncore
mainloop and injecting "fake" requests into Zope's ZPublisher. Despite the
complicated description, it's rather easy to use.
info.name: Products.ClockServer
info.summary: The Zope ClockServer product provides a mechanism for users to call Zope object methods without the use of an external clock source (e.g. cron/wget).
info.html_description: The Zope ClockServer product provides a mechanism for users to call Zope object methods without the use of an external clock source (e.g. cron/wget). It operates by acting as a medusa “server”, essentially coopting Zope’s asyncore mainloop and injecting “fake” requests into Zope’s ZPublisher. Despite the complicated description, it’s rather easy to use.
